intro: Galium shanense, commonly known as Shan bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Galium shanense is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
